solution_line_template: If Roger's age is {roger_more_than_twice_jill} more than twice Jill's age, he is {roger_more_than_twice_jill}+{twice_jill_age}={roger_age_now} years old.
In {years_in_future} years, Jill will be {jill_age_now}+{years_in_future}=<<{jill_age_now}+{years_in_future}={jill_age_future}>>{jill_age_future} years old.
Roger's age will be {roger_age_now}+{years_in_future}=<<{roger_age_now}+{years_in_future}={roger_age_future}>>{roger_age_future} years old in {years_in_future} years.
The age difference between Roger and Jill in fifteen years will be {roger_age_future}-{jill_age_future}=<<{roger_age_future}-{jill_age_future}={age_difference_future}>>{age_difference_future} years

In {years_in_future} years, the age difference between Roger and Jill will be {finley_less_than_age_diff} years less than Finley's age, meaning in fifteen years Finley will be {finley_less_than_age_diff}+{age_difference_future}=<<{finley_less_than_age_diff}+{age_difference_future}={finley_age_future}>>{finley_age_future} years old.
